longInfo:
Passport required.
- Nationals of Germany are allowed to enter with an expired
  passport or an expired national ID Card. These documents are
  accepted when expired for a maximum of 1 year. 
- Nationals of Germany traveling without a passport must have
  a document accepted for entry, valid on arrival. 
Passport Exemptions:
- Holders of a National ID Card: 
 - issued to nationals of Germany;
- Holders of a German Travel Permit Issued in Lieu of Passport
  ("Reiseausweis als Passersatz") or Travel Permit Issued in
  Lieu of Passport for Entry into the Fed. Rep. of Germany
  ("Reiseausweis als Passersatz zur Einreise in die
  Bundesrepublik Deutschland").
- German Child's travel document in lieu of passport
  (Kinderausweis) with photo. For children under 10 years of
  age no photo is required. 

VISA NOT REQUIRED.

Minors:
- WARNING! In accordance with European Union (EU) Legislation,
  all minors who are nationals of Germany will be expected to
  hold their own passport or National ID Card (where
  applicable) when departing from Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus,
  Romania or a Schengen Member State . 
- All minors who are nationals of Germany are expected to hold
  their own travel document
vaccination:
Vaccinations not required. 

Recommended:
- Malaria prophylaxis. malaria risk, exclusively due to P.
  vivax, is very limited and may exist from May to October in
  villages of the Evrotas delta area in Lakonia district in
  agricultural areas with large migrant populations. There is
  no risk in tourist areas. Recommended prevention in risk
  area: A.
